visaPrograms.description: For Turkish citizens pursuing academic education at SEVP-approved US institutions. Allows study at universities, colleges, high schools, language schools, and other academic institutions.

age.note: No maximum age limit for F-1 visa

education.required: High school diploma or equivalent for undergraduate programs. Bachelor's degree for graduate programs.

languageRequirement.note: Some universities may waive language requirements if previous education was in English

financial.description: Must demonstrate ability to pay for full program duration including tuition, living expenses, and dependents

undergraduate.note: Depends on university type and location

specificForTurkishCitizens.note: Turkish citizens must obtain F-1 visa before traveling to USA. Standard F-1 requirements apply.

inState.note: In-state tuition NOT available for international students including Turkish citizens

communityColleges.note: Most affordable option, often used for first 2 years before transferring to 4-year university

SEVIS_I901_Fee.description: Required for all F-1 visa applicants, paid before visa interview

steps.title: University Selection and Research
steps.description: Research SEVP-approved universities and programs that match your goals
actions: Use resources like CollegeBoard, CommonApp, university websites
Check SEVP school database: https://studyinthestates.dhs.gov/school-search
Consider location, cost, program reputation, campus life
Shortlist 8-12 universities (2-3 reach, 4-6 target, 2-3 safety schools)

steps.title: Prepare for Standardized Tests
steps.description: Take required English proficiency and academic tests
actions: Register for TOEFL/IELTS test (book 2-3 months in advance)
Register for SAT/GRE/GMAT as required by programs
Take tests (can retake if needed)
Request official score reports sent to universities

steps.title: Prepare Application Materials
steps.description: Gather all required documents for university applications
actions: Transcripts from all previous education (translated to English if needed)
Letters of recommendation (2-3 from teachers/professors)
Statement of Purpose/Personal Statement
Resume/CV
Portfolio (for art/design programs)
Financial documents showing ability to pay
Copy of passport bio page

documentEvaluation.note: Some universities require credential evaluation by WES or similar

steps.title: Submit University Applications
steps.description: Apply to chosen universities before deadlines

deadlines.note: Earlier submission can improve scholarship chances

actions: Create accounts on CommonApp or individual university portals
Submit online applications with all required materials
Pay application fees
Track application status regularly

steps.title: Receive Admission Decision and I-20
steps.description: Get acceptance letter and I-20 form from university
actions: Receive admission decision (usually 4-8 weeks after deadline)
Accept admission offer from chosen university
Pay enrollment deposit (typically non-refundable)
Submit financial documents to university
Receive Form I-20 (Certificate of Eligibility) from university via mail
Sign the I-20 form

enrollmentDeposit.note: Usually deducted from first semester tuition

steps.importantNote: I-20 form is THE MOST CRITICAL document. Without it, you cannot apply for F-1 visa. Keep multiple copies.

steps.title: Pay SEVIS Fee
steps.description: Pay I-901 SEVIS fee before visa application
steps.timeline: At least 3 days before visa interview
actions: Visit https://www.fmjfee.com/
Complete Form I-901 online
Pay SEVIS fee using credit card or other accepted methods
Print payment confirmation (bring to visa interview)
steps.note: Must be paid at least 3 days before visa interview. Keep receipt - required at interview and US port of entry.

steps.title: Complete DS-160 Visa Application
steps.description: Fill out online nonimmigrant visa application form
actions: Visit https://ceac.state.gov/genniv/
Complete DS-160 form online (save regularly - session expires after 20 minutes of inactivity)
Upload passport-style photo meeting US visa requirements
Print DS-160 confirmation page with barcode
tips: Keep DS-160 confirmation number safe
Use official format for passport photo: 2x2 inches, white background, taken within last 6 months
Answer all questions accurately and consistently

steps.title: Pay Visa Application Fee and Schedule Interview
steps.description: Pay visa fee and book interview appointment at US Embassy/Consulate in Turkey
actions: Create profile on https://ais.usvisa-info.com/en-tr/niv (new system as of May 2025)
Pay visa application fee at designated bank or online
Schedule visa interview appointment
Schedule biometrics appointment (if required separately)
Print appointment confirmation

visaFee.note: Non-refundable, valid for visa applications for one year

waitTime.note: Wait times vary. Check current times at https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/us-visas/visa-information-resources/wait-times.html
waitTime.typical: Can range from few weeks to several months depending on season and post
waitTime.tip: Apply as early as possible. Slots released regularly - check back often for earlier dates.

steps.title: Prepare for Visa Interview
steps.description: Gather all required documents and prepare answers
requiredDocuments: Valid Turkish passport (must be valid for at least 6 months beyond program end date)
One passport-style photo (if not uploaded with DS-160)
Financial documents proving ability to pay (bank statements, sponsor documents, scholarship letters)
Standardized test scores (TOEFL, SAT, GRE, etc.)
Evidence of ties to Turkey (property deeds, family ties, employment letters, etc.)

commonQuestions: Why do you want to study in the US?
Why this university and this program?
How will you finance your education?
What are your plans after graduation?
Do you have family in the US?
What ties do you have to Turkey?
Have you been to the US before?
tips: Be honest and concise
Show strong ties to Turkey (intention to return after studies)
Demonstrate clear academic goals and career plans
Speak English if comfortable - shows language ability
Bring organized documents in a folder
Interview typically lasts 3-5 minutes
Dress professionally

steps.title: Attend Visa Interview
process: Security screening (electronic devices may not be allowed - check embassy website)
Submit passport for visa processing (if approved)
steps.duration: Interview itself: 3-5 minutes. Total time at embassy: 2-4 hours including waiting
steps.languages: Interview conducted in English or Turkish

decision.immediate: Officer will usually indicate if approved or denied immediately
decision.approved: Passport with visa will be returned via courier or pickup in 5-10 business days
decision.denied: You will receive a letter explaining reason. Can reapply but must address concerns.
decision.administrativeProcessing: Some cases require additional review (can take weeks to months)

steps.title: Receive Visa and Prepare for Departure
steps.description: Get passport with visa and prepare to travel
actions: Receive passport with F-1 visa stamp via courier
Verify all information on visa is correct
Book flight (can enter US up to 30 days before I-20 start date)
Arrange housing (on-campus dorms or off-campus apartment)
Purchase health insurance if not provided by university
Prepare financial arrangements for first months

flightTurkeyToUS.note: One-way, varies by season and destination city

steps.title: Entry to United States
steps.description: Enter US and complete arrival procedures
steps.timeline: Up to 30 days before program start date
process: Present passport with F-1 visa at US port of entry
Present I-20 form to CBP officer
Answer questions from Customs and Border Protection officer
Get I-94 admission stamp/record (verify it shows F-1 and D/S - Duration of Status)
tips: Verify I-94 record online at https://i94.cbp.dhs.gov/ after entry
Keep I-20 valid throughout your studies
Report to school's Designated School Official (DSO) within arrival deadline

applicationProcess.totalTimeline: 12-18 months from start of university applications to arrival in USA

totalCostEstimate.note: Application and visa costs only, excluding tuition, living expenses, and flight

conditions: Can work up to 20 hours/week during academic term
Can work full-time during breaks and vacations
Must maintain F-1 status and full-time enrollment

firstYear.note: Off-campus work NOT permitted during first year of studies

CPT.name: Curricular Practical Training
CPT.description: Work authorization for internships/employment integral to curriculum
requirements: Must have been enrolled full-time for at least one academic year
Job must be related to major
Must be authorized by DSO (Designated School Official)
CPT.note: 12+ months of full-time CPT makes you ineligible for OPT

OPT.name: Optional Practical Training
OPT.description: Work authorization in field of study after graduation
OPT.duration: 12 months for all fields, 24-month extension for STEM fields (total 36 months)
requirements: Must apply while still in F-1 status
Job must be related to field of study
Apply to USCIS 90 days before graduation

STEM_extension.eligibleDegrees: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (check STEM designated degree list)

dependents.studyPermission: Part-time recreational or non-degree studies only
dependents.note: F-2 dependents cannot work in the US

options.method: OPT to H-1B to Green Card
options.description: Work on OPT after graduation, employer sponsors H-1B, then employer sponsors Green Card (EB-2/EB-3)
options.timeline: 3-6+ years depending on category and country of birth
options.probability: Moderate - depends on finding sponsoring employer and H-1B lottery

options.description: Self-petition for Green Card if you demonstrate extraordinary ability in sciences, arts, education, business, or athletics
options.probability: Low - very high bar for qualification

options.description: Self-petition for Green Card if your work is in US national interest (PhD holders, researchers)
options.probability: Low-Medium - requires advanced degree and significant achievements

options.description: Marriage to US citizen during or after studies
Enter Diversity Visa Lottery annually (if still maintaining F-1 status)

pathToPermanentResidency.note: F-1 visa allows dual intent - you can pursue Green Card while maintaining F-1 status
pathToPermanentResidency.turkishCitizenAdvantage: Turkey is in 'Rest of World' category for employment-based Green Cards (faster than India/China)

insurance.description: All F-1 students must have health insurance - it's mandatory at most universities

options.description: Most universities offer their own health insurance plans
options.enrollment: Usually automatic unless you waive with proof of alternative coverage

options.description: ISO (International Student Insurance), HTH Worldwide, IMG, etc.
options.note: Must meet university's minimum coverage requirements to waive university plan

vaccines: COVID-19 (may be required by some universities)

cost.note: If vaccinations not already completed in Turkey. Can often be done cheaper in Turkey before departure.

acceptedTests.note: Most universities require 80+ for undergraduate, 90+ for graduate
Increasingly accepted, cheaper and more convenient

exemptions: Some universities waive for high SAT/ACT verbal scores

visaValidity.statusDuration: D/S (Duration of Status) - valid for entire academic program plus 60-day grace period after completion or OPT

extensions.process: Automatic if you get new I-20 for continued studies (transfer, change program, etc.). Visa stamp itself doesn't need renewal if it hasn't expired and you don't leave US.

newVisaStamp.note: Only needed if you leave US and visa stamp has expired

gracePeriod.beforeProgramStart: 30 days - can enter US up to 30 days before I-20 start date
gracePeriod.afterCompletion: 60 days - must leave US, transfer to another program, or change status within 60 days of completion
gracePeriod.afterOPT: 60 days grace period after OPT expires

Istanbul.name: U.S. Consulate General Istanbul
Istanbul.address: Kaplicalar Mevkii No. 2, Istinye, 34460 Istanbul, Turkey

Adana.name: U.S. Consulate Adana
Adana.address: Girne Bulvarı, Güzelyalı Mahallesi, No. 212, 01170 Adana, Turkey

StateDepartment.name: U.S. Department of State - Bureau of Consular Affairs

bilateralAgreements.note: No special bilateral agreements between Turkey and USA for student visas. Turkish citizens follow standard F-1 process like all other international students.

communitySupport.description: Large Turkish community in USA (350,000-400,000) provides support network
organizations: Turkish Student Association chapters at most major universities
Cultural centers and mosques in areas with Turkish populations

tips: Show strong ties to Turkey at visa interview (family, property, job prospects)
Be clear about post-graduation plans - returning to Turkey vs staying for OPT
Many Turkish students succeed - F-1 approval rate generally good for genuine students
Consider universities in areas with Turkish communities (NYC, Boston, Chicago, Houston)
Join Turkish student groups on Facebook for advice and support

educationUSA.description: Official US government advising service for international students

processingTime.visaInterview: Varies by embassy workload - check wait times at travel.state.gov
processingTime.administrativeProcessing: Can take weeks to several months if additional review needed
processingTime.total: Allow 6-12 months from application submission to visa approval

commonRejectionReasons: Weak ties to home country (concern about immigration intent)
Poor English skills (if interviewed in English)
importantNotes: F-1 visa allows 'dual intent' - you can pursue Green Card while maintaining student status
Can change universities or programs - get new I-20 from new school and report to SEVP
Must maintain full-time enrollment (usually 12+ credits undergraduate, 9+ graduate)
Can take online classes but must maintain majority in-person enrollment (check current regulations)
Social Security Number: Can apply after getting on-campus job or authorized off-campus work
Driver's license: Can obtain in most states with valid F-1 status and proof of address
Leaving and returning: Can travel outside US and return with valid F-1 visa, I-20, and passport. Get I-20 signed by DSO for travel every 12 months.
STEM OPT is huge advantage - total 3 years of work authorization after graduation

types.description: Awarded based on academic excellence, test scores, extracurriculars
types.amount: USD 5,000-30,000 per year (can cover partial to full tuition)
types.note: More common at private universities. Apply during admission process.

types.description: Teaching or research positions for graduate students
types.availability: Common for PhD programs, less common for Master's

examples: Fulbright Turkey - for graduate study and research
Turkish Ministry of Education scholarships for study abroad

types.amount: Can cover full cost of attendance
types.note: Very competitive, must meet NCAA requirements

tips: Apply to multiple universities to compare financial aid packages
Check university websites for international student scholarships
Apply early - better chances for merit scholarships
Contact department directly for graduate assistantship opportunities

sources.title: U.S. Department of State - Student Visa
IDP Turkey - Cost of Study in USA

disclaimer: This information is collected from official sources and is accurate as of November 2025. However, visa regulations and requirements can change. Always verify current requirements with official U.S. government sources and the U.S. Embassy in Turkey before making decisions or applications.
nextSteps: See usa-emigration-data-PART2.json for work visa programs (H-1B, O-1, L-1) and Green Card pathways (EB-1, EB-2, EB-3, DV Lottery)
